Utils (libsoni.util.utils)

libsoni.util.utils.envelope_signal(signal: ndarray, attack_time: float = 0, decay_time: float = 0, sustain_level: float = 0, release_time: float = 0, fs=44100)[source]

Envelopes a given signal. If the length of the signal is too short regarding the specified ADSR parameters, the returned signal is zero. :param signal: signal to envelope :type signal: array-like

Returns:

enveloped_signal – enveloped signal

Return type:

array-like

libsoni.util.utils.fade_signal(signal: ndarray | None = None, fs: int = 22050, fading_sec: float = 0.01) → ndarray[source]

Fade in / out audio signal :param signal: Signal to be faded :type signal: np.ndarray, default = None :param fs: sampling rate :type fs: int, default = 22050 :param fading_sec: :type fading_sec: float, default = 0

Returns:

normalized_signal – Normalized signal

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.util.utils.format_df(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]
libsoni.util.utils.get_preset(preset_name: str | None = None) → Dict[source]

Get preset parameters from presets.json

Parameters:

preset_name (str, default: None) – Name of preset, e.g., violin

Return type:

dictionary of partials, envelope, etc.

libsoni.util.utils.mix_sonification_and_original(sonification: ndarray, original_audio: ndarray, gain_lin_sonification: float = 1.0, gain_lin_original_audio: float = 1.0, panning: float = 1.0, duration: int | None = None)[source]

This function takes a sonification and an original_audio and mixes it to stereo

Parameters:

  • sonification (np.ndarray) – sonification

  • original_audio (np.ndarray) – original_audio

  • gain_lin_sonification (float, default = 1.0) – linear gain for sonification

  • gain_lin_original_audio (float, default = 1.0) – linear gain for original audio

  • panning (float, default = 1.0) –

    Controls the panning of the mixed output

    panning = 1.0 means original audio on left and sonification on right channel panning = 0.5 means same amount of both signals on both channels. panning = 0.0 means sonification on left and original audio on right channel

  • duration (int, default = None) – Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

Returns:

mixed_audio – Mix of the signals

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.util.utils.normalize_signal(signal: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Normalize audio signal :param signal: Signal to be normalized :type signal: np.ndarray

Returns:

normalized_signal – Normalized signal

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.util.utils.plot_sonify_novelty_beats(fn_wav, fn_ann, title='')[source]
libsoni.util.utils.smooth_weights(weights: ndarray, fading_samples: int = 0)[source]
libsoni.util.utils.warp_sample(sample: ndarray, reference_pitch: int, target_pitch: int, target_duration_sec: float, fs=22050, fading_sec: float = 0.01)[source]

This function warps a sample. Given the reference pitch of the sample provided as np.ndarray, the warped version of the sample gets pitch-shifted using librosa.effects.pitch_shift(). For the temporal alignment, if the desired duration is shorter than the original sample, the sample gets cropped, else if the desired duration is longer of the provided sample, the returned signal gets zero-padded at the end. :param sample: Sample to be warped. :type sample: np.ndarray :param reference_pitch: Reference pitch for the given sample. :type reference_pitch: int :param target_pitch: Target pitch for the warped sample. :type target_pitch: int :param target_duration_sec: Duration, given in seconds, for the returned signal. :type target_duration_sec: float :param fs: Sampling rate, in samples per seconds. :type fs: int, default = 22050 :param fading_sec: Duration of fade in and fade out (to avoid clicks) :type fading_sec: float, default = 0.01

Returns:

warped_sample – Warped sample.

Return type:

np.ndarray
